result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M Rawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. Defendant must complete the Substance Abuse Program, before he is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  AMENDED 11/12/14.  Days of credit ordered is zero.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 12CF216.
Consecutive to: Jackson County Case No. 12CF20.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  AMENDED 10/17/14.  Defendant's gift monies in his inmate account are exempt from assignment for payment of court costs.
Obtain and maintain full time employment in an occupation acceptable to his agent.
Attend and successfully complete alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment  and comply with any recommended treatment.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  If medication is prescribed, defendant must notify his agent of any prescriptions within 48 hours.  Prescriptions may only be filled at one pharmacy.  Not to be present at any place where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

No contact with any known drug users and any known drug dealers.  Obey all other no contact orders made by his agent.

  Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.

Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessment, counseling and treatment to allow agent to verify compliance.     The defendant shall cooperate with and participate in any assessments, treatment and/or programming as determined appropriate based on the defendant's assessed risk and criminogenic needs, and as directed by the Department of Corrections.  Obtain housing that is acceptable to his agent.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 12CF216
Consecutive to: Jackson County Case No. 12CF20.
